data.citation: 'GREEDuck Season Looks Great Break Out those Smoke Poles, Guys, the Ducks are on their Way. 'we'Ve Got Lots of Places for Ducks to be and that's Going to be Good for the Hunters,' Said Brian Sullivan, Duck Program Leader for the Texas Parks and Wildlife Department. Tropical Storms and Favorable Weather to the North have Refilled Creeks and Ponds and Canals, Spreading Out Duck Populations Once they Come to Texas to Spend the Winter. 'Duck Numbers Held their Own, and most Species are Holding their Own,' Sullivan Said. 'the Prospects for the Regular Season are very Good.' 'I'Ve been Encouraged by the Recent Tropical Storms,' Sullivan Said. 'they'Ve really Rejuvenated our Coastal Areas. and the Panhandle Got Rain and that's Going to have a Major Impact on the Whole Central Flyway.' Texans Already are Allowed to Take as Many as Six Ducks Per Day, the Highest Number since the Old Point System of the 1970s and 1980s. Hunter Numbers have been Climbing and Sullivan Thinks.'
